content: i needed a nice quick pattern for holiday gifts that was functional and still looked nice i love knitting fingerless mitts and i love the practicality of convertibles but i wanted something simple and not too fiddly plus i donʼt like the flappy bit on top of my hand when not using the convertible part i came up with a mitt with a nice long top that can be folded down or unfolded to cover your fingers that you can knit in one evening long flap fingerless mitts yarn bulky weight yarn approx 115 yards the example shown was made with madelinetosh tosh chunky yarn in william morris needle size 9 - 32 circular needles for magic loop gauge 4 sts to the inch k2p2 rib - knit 2 stitches purl 2 stitches pm - place marker sm - slip marker m1r - insert the left needle from the back to front under the bar between the stitches knit the stitch through the front loop m1l - insert the left needle from the front to the back under the bar between the titches knit the stitch through the back loop k1p1 rib - knit 1 stitch purl 1 stitch directions loosely cast on 32 stitches 16 stitches on each needle holding the two needles parallel to each other pass first stitch on left needle over to the right needle pass 2nd stitch on right needle over 1st stitch that you just put there and over to the left needle this locks the stitches together so you can begin knitting in the round be careful not to twist the stitches rounds 1 - 10 k2p2 rib rounds 11 - 25 knit begin thumb increases increasing a total of 8 stitches round 26 k1 m1r k1 m1l k1 pm - k to end of round round 27 knit round 28 k2 m1r k1 m1l k2 sm - k to end of round round 29 knit round 30 k3 m1r k1 m1l k3 sm - k to end of round round 31 knit round 32 k4 m1r k1 m1l k4 sm - k to end of round round 33 knit transfer 11 thumb stitches before the marker to holder i use a different color yarn as a holder round 34 knit - but stop before the last stitch on that round knit the last stitch of current round and first stitch of next round together 28 stitches on needles in order to knit the 2 stitches together you will need to slide the last stitch over the cable to the other needle rounds 35 & 36 knit rounds 37 - 56 k2p2 rib bind off loosely in pattern thumb transfer 11 stitches to your needles 5 on one needle and 6 on the other needle pick up 3 stitches from the body of the mitt so there are 6 stitches on one needle and 8 stitches on the other needle rounds 1 - 3 knit rounds 4 - 6 k1p1 rib bind off
